poem:
**Atmospheric Rivers**

Ink from the sky's quill  
drips a deluge  
on the Pacific spine;  
rivers unfurl in air,  
spill into valleys and veins,  
etch fast-moving legends down slopes.  
Snow hears the wet whisper of rain,  
begins its own cascade—  
a world remade under  
the beat of persistent drums.  
White pages turned,  
storm after storm.
